class.name: BulletType
class.brief_description: Resource containing appearance and behaviour data for [Bullet]s.
class.description: Resource containing [Bullet] appearance and behaviour data. Serves as a means of applying various "types" to bullets without having to reinstantiate the objects, for compatibility with [BulletServer]'s fixed bullet pool model.

members.member: If [code]true[/code], this type of bullet will scan for areas in its collision checks.
If [code]true[/code], this type of bullet will scan for bodies in its collision checks.
The physics layers to scan for determining collision detection with this type of bullet.
Shape to be used for determining collision detection with this type of bullet.
Rate at which this type of bullet will curve as it flies, in degrees per second.
Generic dictionary container for any extra data needed by game-specific logic.
Amount of damage associated with this bullet type.
If [code]true[/code], this type of bullet will automatically rotate to face the direction in which it is travelling. The rotation effect applied by this stacks with [code]rotation[/code].

The amplitude of this type of bullet's parallel offset wave. Measured in pixels, and determines the maximum distance this type of bullet will be displaced along its trajectory by the parallel offset wave.
The frequency of this type of bullet's parallel offset wave. Measured in Hz, and determines how many times per second the parallel offset wave will repeat.
The wave type applied to this type of bullet's parallel offset.

The maximum lifetime of this type of bullet. Bullets that are active beyond this period are automatically popped. If set to [code]0[/code], this type of bullet's lifetime is unlimited. If the current [BulletServer] has an active [code]max_lifetime[/code] as well, the shorter of the two will be applied.
The light mask for this type of bullet's [code]CanvasItem[/code].
The acceleration of this type of bullet along its trajectory. Measured in pixels/sec/sec.
The material applied to this type of bullet's [CanvasItem].
The color that modulates this type of bullet's [CanvasItem].
The rotation offset of this type of bullet, in radians.
The rotation offset of this type of bullet, in degrees.
The scale applied to this type of bullet.
The initial speed of this type of bullet, in pixels/sec.
The texture to be drawn to this type of bullet's [CanvasItem]. If absent, the collision shape will be drawn instead.

The amplitude of this type of bullet's perpendicular offset wave. Measured in pixels, and determines the maximum distance this type of bullet will be displaced perpendicularly to its trajectory by the perpendicular offset wave.
The frequency of this type of bullet's perpendicular offset wave. Measured in Hz, and determines how many times per second the perpendicular offset wave will repeat.
The wave type applied to this type of bullet's perpendicular offset.
